column1: TA4.20;The death toll for all modes of transport should be close to zero in the EU.;TA4.45;+;The implementation of TA4.20
column2: which aims to reduce the death toll for all modes of transport
column3: is likely to have a positive impact on TA4.45
column4: which aims to have zero-emission ocean-going vessels
column5: as reducing transport-related deaths can lead to increased investment in sustainable and safe transportation modes
column6: including zero-emission vessels.;The connection between these two targets is based on the idea that improving transport safety can lead to increased adoption of sustainable transport modes
column7: which in turn can contribute to reducing emissions and achieving climate goals.

column1: TA4.21;In a third phase
column2: from 2030 onwards and towards 2050
column3: renewable hydrogen technologies should reach maturity and be deployed at large scale to reach all hard-to-decarbonise sectors where other alternatives might not be feasible or have higher costs.;TA4.45;+;The implementation of TA4.21
column4: which aims to deploy renewable hydrogen technologies at large scale
column5: is likely to have a positive impact on TA4.45
column6: which aims to have zero-emission ocean-going vessels
column7: as renewable hydrogen can be used as a zero-emission fuel for vessels.;The connection between these two targets is based on the idea that the development and deployment of renewable hydrogen technologies can contribute to the decarbonization of the transport sector

column1: TA4.25;Member States shall ensure that
column2: at the end of each year
column3: starting from the year referred to in Article 26
column4: the following power output targets are met cumulatively: (a) for each light-duty battery electric vehicle registered in their territory
column5: a total power output of at least 1
column6: 3 kW is provided through publicly accessible recharging stations
column7: and (b) for each light-duty plug-in hybrid vehicle registered in their territory
column8: a total power output of at least 0
column9: 80 kW is provided through publicly accessible recharging stations.;TA4.45;+;The implementation of TA4.25
column10: which aims to ensure that Member States provide sufficient power output for electric and hybrid vehicles
column11: is likely to have a positive impact on TA4.45
column12: which aims to have zero-emission ocean-going vessels
column13: as the development of recharging infrastructure can contribute to the adoption of electric and hybrid vessels.;The connection between these two targets is based on the idea that the development of recharging infrastructure can support the transition to zero-emission transportation modes

column1: TA4.26;Member States shall ensure that along the TEN-T core and comprehensive networks
column2: publicly accessible recharging pools dedicated to light-duty vehicles are deployed in each direction of travel with a maximum distance of 60 km in-between them offering a power output of at least 600kW and including at least one recharging point with an individual power output of at least 150 kW.;TA4.45;+;The implementation of TA4.26
column3: which aims to ensure that Member States deploy recharging pools along the TEN-T core and comprehensive networks
column4: is likely to have a positive impact on TA4.45

column6: as the development of recharging infrastructure can contribute to the adoption of electric and hybrid vessels.;The connection between these two targets is based on the idea that the development of recharging infrastructure can support the transition to zero-emission transportation modes

column1: TA4.3;The yearly average GHG intensity of the energy used on board by a ship during a reporting period shall not exceed these limits: 2 % from 1 January 2025
